info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 1:48PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cabarrus and central Mecklenburg Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 148 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of Uptown Charlotte, or near Northeast Charlotte, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Uptown Charlotte, Downtown Concord, Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, East Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, West Concord, Mint Hill, Harrisburg and University City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
